faqs.question: What is the adoption process like?
faqs.answer1: The adoption process typically involves filling out an application, meeting with an adoption counselor, and sometimes a home visit. We want to ensure that our dogs find loving and suitable homes.
faqs.answer2: As easy as it sounds, our Dog Adoption Center employee will help every step of the way if you find yourself having any issues.

faqs.question: Are the dogs up-to-date on vaccinations?
faqs.answer1: Yes, all our dogs are up-to-date on vaccinations, and they are spayed or neutered before adoption to promote responsible pet ownership.
faqs.answer2: Generally, all dogs at the adoption center receive up-to-date vaccinations as part of their comprehensive care plan.

faqs.question: Can I bring my current pets to meet a potential new dog?
faqs.answer1: Absolutely! We encourage meet-and-greets with your existing pets to ensure compatibility and a smooth transition.
faqs.answer2: It's often recommended to arrange a supervised meet-and-greet at the adoption center or a neutral location to assess the compatibility and interaction between the animals before making a final decision on adoption.
